duck: Domain Name System - The Domain Name System (DNS) is a hierarchical distributed naming system for computers, services, or any resource connected to the Internet or a private network.
Protein domains - A protein domain is a part of protein sequence and structure that can evolve, function, and exist independently of the rest of the protein chain.
Vanity domain - In the Domain Name System, a vanity domain is a domain name whose purpose is to express the individuality of the person on whose behalf it is registered.
Domain name - A domain name is an identification string that defines a realm of administrative autonomy, authority, or control on the Internet.

Hostname - A hostname is a label that is assigned to a device connected to a computer network and that is used to identify the device in various forms of electronic communication such as the World Wide Web...

Subdirectory - In computing, a folder, catalog, or drawer, is a virtual container within a graphical user interface, in which groups of computer files and possibly other directories can be kept and...
In the Domain Name System (DNS) hierarchy, a subdomain is a domain that is part of a larger domain.

milestones: Google suffers DNS outage
Google offers to help Wikipedia

wiki.text:
In the Domain Name System (DNS) hierarchy, a 'subdomain' is a domain that is
part of a larger domain.<ref name="RFC 1034 section 3.1"></ref>
wiki.title: subdomain
